data.name: AMZKeyDescriptionLong
data.value: The AWS "Secret Access Key" can be obtained after logging into your AWS account, this can also be supplied through the "ftp-password" property

data.name: AMZKeyDescriptionShort
data.value: The AWS "Secret Access Key"

data.name: AMZUserIDDescriptionLong
data.value: The AWS "Access Key ID" can be obtained after logging into your AWS account, this can also be supplied through the "ftp-username" property

data.name: AMZUserIDDescriptionShort
data.value: The AWS "Access Key ID"

data.name: DisplayName
data.value: Amazon S3 based

data.name: FTPPasswordDescriptionLong
data.value: The password used to connect to the server. This may also be supplied as the environment variable "FTP_PASSWORD".

data.name: FTPPasswordDescriptionShort
data.value: Supplies the password used to connect to the server

data.name: DescriptionFTPUsernameLong
data.value: The username used to connect to the server. This may also be supplied as the environment variable "FTP_USERNAME".

data.name: DescriptionFTPUsernameShort
data.value: Supplies the username used to connect to the server

data.name: NoAMZKeyError
data.value: No Amazon S3 secret key given

data.name: NoAMZUserIDError
data.value: No Amazon S3 userID given

data.name: S3EurobucketDescriptionLong
data.value: This flag is only used when creating new buckets. If the flag is set, the bucket is created on a european server. This flag forces the "s3-use-new-style" flag. Amazon charges slightly more for european buckets.

data.name: S3EurobucketDescriptionShort
data.value: Use a European server

data.name: S3NewStyleDescriptionLong
data.value: Specify this argument to make the S3 backend use subdomains rather than the previous url prefix method. See the Amazon S3 documentation for more details.

data.name: S3NewStyleDescriptionShort
data.value: Use subdomain calling style

data.name: UnableToDecodeBucketnameError
data.value: Unable to determine the bucket name for host: {0}

data.name: S3UseRRSDescriptionLong
data.value: This flag toggles the use of the special RRS header. Files stored using RRS are more likely to disapear than those stored normally, but also costs less to store. See the full description here: http://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/whats-new/2010/05/19/announcing-amazon-s3-reduced-redundancy-storage/

data.name: S3UseRRSDescriptionShort
data.value: Use Reduced Redundancy Storage

data.name: DeprecatedUrlFormat
data.value: You are using a deprected url format, please change it to: {0}

data.name: Description_v2
data.value: This backend can read and write data to an Amazon S3 compatible server. Allowed formats are: "s3://bucketname/prefix"

data.name: OptionsAreMutuallyExclusiveError
data.value: The options --{0} and --{1} are mutually exclusive

data.name: S3EurobucketDeprecationDescription
data.value: Please use --{0}={1} instead

data.name: S3LocationDescriptionLong
data.value: This option is only used when creating new buckets. Use this option to change what region the data is stored in. Amazon charges slightly more for non-US buckets. Known bucket locations: {0}

data.name: S3LocationDescriptionShort
data.value: Specifies S3 location constraints

data.name: S3ServerNameDescriptionLong
data.value: Companies other than Amazon are now supporting the S3 API, meaning that this backend can read and write data to those providers as well. Use this option to set the hostname. Currently known providers are: {0}

data.name: S3ServerNameDescriptionShort
data.value: Specifies an alternate S3 server name

data.name: UnableToParseURLError
data.value: Could not parse the url: {0}

data.name: S3NewStyleDeprecation
data.value: The subdomain calling option does nothing, the library will pick the right calling convention

data.name: DescriptionUseSSLLong
data.value: Use this flag to communicate using Secure Socket Layer (SSL) over http (https). Note that bucket names containing a period has problems with SSL connections.

data.name: DescriptionUseSSLShort
data.value: Instructs Duplicati to use an SSL (https) connection
